7:["$","div",null,{"className":"text-sm text-muted-foreground","children":"Path to Permanent"}]
8:["$","section",null,{"className":"py-16","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"container mx-auto px-4","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"max-w-3xl mx-auto","children":[["$","h2",null,{"className":"text-3xl font-bold mb-6 text-center","children":"Overview"}],["$","div",null,{"className":"prose prose-lg dark:prose-invert mx-auto","children":[["$","p",null,{"className":"text-muted-foreground leading-relaxed","children":"Argentina's employment-based residency, commonly referred to as the work visa, is designed for foreign nationals who have secured a job with an Argentine employer. Unlike many countries that impose strict quotas or require labor market tests, Argentina's system is relatively straightforward once you have an employer willing to sponsor you."}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-muted-foreground leading-relaxed mt-4","children":"The process is managed by the Direccion Nacional de Migraciones (DNM), Argentina's immigration authority. Your employer plays a central role, as they must initiate the process and provide documentation proving the legitimacy of the employment relationship. Once approved, you receive a temporary residency permit (residencia temporaria) valid for one to three years, depending on your contract and nationality."}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-muted-foreground leading-relaxed mt-4","children":"This visa grants you full work authorization in Argentina, access to the public healthcare system, the ability to open bank accounts, sign rental contracts, and build a life in the country. After two to three years of temporary residency, you become eligible to apply for permanent residency, and Argentine citizenship is available after just two years of permanent residence. The entire pathway from arrival to citizenship can be completed in as few as four to five years."}]]}]]}]}]}]

The employer must be a legally constituted entity registered with AFIP (the Argentine tax authority). Larger companies and multinational firms with local offices are the most common sponsors."}]]}]]}],["$","div","2",{"data-slot":"card","className":"bg-card text-card-foreground flex-col rounded-xl border shadow-sm flex gap-4 p-6","children":[["$","div",null,{"className":"flex-shrink-0 w-10 h-10 rounded-full bg-primary text-primary-foreground flex items-center justify-center font-bold","children":2}],["$","div",null,{"children":[["$","h3",null,{"className":"font-semibold text-lg mb-2","children":"Employer Initiates the Process"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-muted-foreground","children":"Your employer files a request with the Direccion Nacional de Migraciones. They must provide their company registration documents, tax filings, and a justification for hiring a foreign worker, including proof the role could not be filled locally."}]]}]]}],["$","div","3",{"data-slot":"card","className":"bg-card text-card-foreground flex-col rounded-xl border shadow-sm flex gap-4 p-6","children":[["$","div",null,{"className":"flex-shrink-0 w-10 h-10 rounded-full bg-primary text-primary-foreground flex items-center justify-center font-bold","children":3}],["$","div",null,{"children":[["$","h3",null,{"className":"font-semibold text-lg mb-2","children":"Gather Your Personal Documents"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-muted-foreground","children":"Collect your passport, apostilled birth certificate, police clearance certificates, educational credentials, employment contract, and passport-sized photos. All foreign documents must be apostilled and translated into Spanish by a certified public translator in Argentina."}]]}]]}],["$","div","4",{"data-slot":"card","className":"bg-card text-card-foreground flex-col rounded-xl border shadow-sm flex gap-4 p-6","children":[["$","div",null,{"className":"flex-shrink-0 w-10 h-10 rounded-full bg-primary text-primary-foreground flex items-center justify-center font-bold","children":4}],["$","div",null,{"children":[["$","h3",null,{"className":"font-semibold text-lg mb-2","children":"Submit the Application"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-muted-foreground","children":"File your residency application at the Direccion Nacional de Migraciones office in Buenos Aires or online through the Radex digital platform. Your employer may need to be present or provide a power of attorney for certain steps."}]]}]]}],["$","div","5",{"data-slot":"card","className":"bg-card text-card-foreground flex-col rounded-xl border shadow-sm flex gap-4 p-6","children":[["$","div",null,{"className":"flex-shrink-0 w-10 h-10 rounded-full bg-primary text-primary-foreground flex items-center justify-center font-bold","children":5}],["$","div",null,{"children":[["$","h3",null,{"className":"font-semibold text-lg mb-2","children":"Biometrics and Interview"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-muted-foreground","children":"Attend an appointment at Migraciones for fingerprinting and photograph. You may be asked basic questions about your employment and plans in Argentina. Bring all original documents and copies."}]]}]]}],"$L17"]}]]}]}]}]

receipts for all applicable government fees"}]]}]]}]}]}]]}]}]}]
c:["$","section",null,{"className":"py-16","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"container mx-auto px-4","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"max-w-3xl mx-auto","children":[["$","h2",null,{"className":"text-3xl font-bold mb-8 text-center","children":"Expected Timeline"}],["$","div",null,{"className":"space-y-4","children":[["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card","className":"bg-card text-card-foreground flex flex-col gap-6 rounded-xl border shadow-sm p-6","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"flex items-center gap-4","children":[["$","$L18",null,{"size":"md","className":"text-primary flex-shrink-0"}],["$","div",null,{"children":[["$","h3",null,{"className":"font-semibold","children":"Weeks 1-4: Document Gathering"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-muted-foreground text-sm","children":"Obtain police clearances, apostille documents, and arrange certified translations. d:["$","section",null,{"className":"py-16 bg-muted/30","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"container mx-auto px-4","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"max-w-3xl mx-auto","children":["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card","className":"text-card-foreground flex flex-col gap-6 rounded-xl border py-6 shadow-sm border-amber-200 bg-amber-50 dark:bg-amber-950/20","children":["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-content","className":"px-6 pt-6","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"flex items-start gap-4","children":[["$","$L19",null,{"size":"lg","className":"text-amber-600 flex-shrink-0"}],["$","div",null,{"children":[["$","h3",null,{"className":"font-semibold text-amber-900 dark:text-amber-100 mb-2","children":"Reality Check"}],["$","ul",null,{"className":"text-amber-800 dark:text-amber-200 text-sm space-y-2","children":[["$","li",null,{"children":[["$","strong",null,{"children":"Processing delays are common."}]," While the official timeline suggests 2-6 months, delays at Migraciones are frequent. Budget extra time and do not make irreversible plans based on a specific approval date."]}],["$","li",null,{"children":[["$","strong",null,{"children":"Apostilles take time."}]," Getting documents apostilled from abroad can take weeks or months. Start this process as early as possible, ideally before arriving in Argentina."]}],["$","li",null,{"children":[["$","strong",null,{"children":"Salaries in Argentina are lower."}]," If you are being hired locally, be aware that Argentine salaries are significantly lower than in North America or Europe, even for skilled positions. Factor in the cost of living advantage, but set realistic salary expectations."]}],["$","li",null,{"children":[["$","strong",null,{"children":"Currency and banking are complicated."}]," Argentina has a complex financial system with multiple exchange rates. Your employer will pay you in Argentine pesos. Understanding the financial landscape is essential before committing to a local salary."]}],["$","li",null,{"children":[["$","strong",null,{"children":"You need an immigration lawyer."}]," While it is technically possible to navigate this process alone, the bureaucracy is complex and largely conducted in Spanish. A qualified immigration attorney can prevent costly mistakes and expedite the process."]}]]}]]}]]}]}]}]}]}]}]
e:["$","section",null,{"className":"py-16","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"container mx-auto px-4","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"max-w-3xl mx-auto","children":[["$","h2",null,{"className":"text-3xl font-bold mb-8 text-center","children":"Frequently Asked Questions"}],["$","$L1a",null,{"type":"single","collapsible":true,"className":"w-full","children":[["$","$L1b","0",{"value":"item-0","children":[["$","$L1c",null,{"children":"Can I change employers while on a work visa?"}],["$","$L1d",null,{"children":"Yes, but you must notify Migraciones and update your residency records. Your new employer will need to provide a new employment contract and supporting documentation. It is advisable to complete this process before leaving your current position to avoid gaps in your legal status."}]]}],["$","$L1b","1",{"value":"item-1","children":[["$","$L1c",null,{"children":"Does my employer pay for the visa process?"}],["$","$L1d",null,{"children":"There is no legal requirement for the employer to cover visa costs, but many companies do cover the fees and legal expenses as part of their relocation package. This is something to negotiate during your hiring process. At minimum, the employer bears the costs of their own filings."}]]}],["$","$L1b","2",{"value":"item-2","children":[["$","$L1c",null,{"children":"Can I bring my family on a work visa?"}],["$","$L1d",null,{"children":"Yes. Your spouse, registered partner, and minor children can apply for dependent residency permits tied to your work visa. Each family member needs their own set of documents including apostilled birth or marriage certificates. Family members receive the same residency duration as the primary applicant."}]]}],["$","$L1b","3",{"value":"item-3","children":[["$","$L1c",null,{"children":"What happens if I lose my job?"}],["$","$L1d",null,{"children":"If your employment ends, your residency does not automatically expire. You have a grace period to find new employment or change your visa category. However, at renewal time, you will need to demonstrate current employment or apply under a different residency category. Consult an immigration attorney promptly if your employment situation changes."}]]}],["$","$L1b","4",{"value":"item-4","children":[["$","$L1c",null,{"children":"Can I work for multiple employers?"}],["$","$L1d",null,{"children":"Your primary visa is tied to one employer, but once you have your DNI and temporary residency, you can legally work for other employers as well. Many residents take on additional freelance or part-time work. You must comply with Argentine labor and tax laws for all income sources."}]]}],["$","$L1b","5",{"value":"item-5","children":[["$","$L1c",null,{"children":"How do I convert temporary residency to permanent?"}],["$","$L1d",null,{"children":"After holding temporary residency for two to three years (depending on your nationality and circumstances), you can apply for permanent residency. You must demonstrate continuous residence in Argentina, ongoing employment or income, and compliance with tax obligations. Permanent residency has no expiration date."}]]}]]}]]}]}]}]
